alert.note: Alert for Northern High Plains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 07 at 3:43AM MST until December 07 at 11:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Northern High Plains. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 5 PM MST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 11 AM MST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery or snow covered road conditions. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. Drifting snow may also cause lane blockages. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
